alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 8:03PM PDT until July 18 at 9:30PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LYON COUNTY... At 803 PM PDT, Showers and thunderstorms have moved out of the warned area. However, runoff from nearby mountains is still possible, as radar indicated in excess of 3 inches of rain have fallen this evening. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, along Highway 338 as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas is still possible. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Smith Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
